trg_text: International Nurses Day (12 May) Cabinet noted that its meeting was taking place on the day the world marked International Nurses Day and reiterated its message of gratitude to the nurses in South Africa, the continent of Africa and the world for their selflessness and dedication in the face of the deadly COVID-19 pandemi Nurses, together with other health workers, continue to be at the frontline in the fight against COVID-19 at personal risk to their own lives and risk of exposure to their familie Government remain indebted to the resilience, sacrifice and tenacity of South Africa s nurses in the fight against COVID-19.

trg_text: Cabinet approved the submission of the Agricultural Products Standards Amendment Bill for tabling in Parliamen The Agricultural Product Standards Act, 1990 (Act 119 of 1990) provides for the control of sales and exports of certain agricultural products and promotes food safet The interventions seek to protect consumer The proposed amendments strengthen the regulatory framework for agricultural production, health and food safety of certain agricultural product The Bill tightens the control systems in areas of labelling claims in products for sale, and introduces different inspections and auditing methods, amongst other
